intro: Tarenna sylvestris, commonly known as the forest tarenna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. Tarenna sylvestris is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
